summary: The Final Honors Act of 2025 allows the remains of certain members of the Armed Forces who died in line of duty to lie in honor in the rotunda of the United States Capitol.  At the request of the primary surviving next of kin, and excluding those injured under section 105 of title 38, the bill mandates the Secretary concerned to notify the surviving next of kin. The Architect of the Capitol, under the direction of the Speaker of the House and the President pro tempore of the Senate, will manage the arrangements. The act applies to those who die on or after the enactment date.
